timeline.bodyText: ❓ so does this get function override the default get method? in other words, does this method get called every time we do user.get(...) ?
timeline.author: cassandrabailey293

replies.bodyText: this get function override the default get method for preferences, so when we do user.get('user').get('preferences').get('resultFilter'), so in this case would be the .get('resultFilter')
replies.author: abel-connexta

replies.bodyText: ok, as long as it preserves the behavior of user.get('user').get('preferences').get(...) for the non- result filter cases, then we're good
replies.author: cassandrabailey293

replies.bodyText:
Yep it does, line 210 gets attributes as it usually does, and only alters data for 'resultFilter'. 
  
    
      ddf/ui/packages/catalog-ui-search/src/main/webapp/js/model/User.js
    
    
         Line 210
      in
      bc9c874
    
    
    
    

        
          
           const value = Backbone.AssociatedModel.prototype.get.call(this, attr)
replies.author: abel-connexta
